meanings.definition: An object made by a human being, typically of cultural or historical interest.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artefact was carefully displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist discovered an artefact from the Roman Empire.
meanings.sent3: The artefact seemed to whisper stories of the past to those who gazed upon it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a precious artefact, rare and full of history.
meanings.sent5: The artefact gleamed under the museum lights, captivating all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A structure or feature not naturally present but visible as a result of human activity.
meanings.sent1: The ruins of the old castle were a fascinating artefact of the past.
meanings.sent2: The crop circles were considered an artefact of alien visitation by some.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious artefact in the field turned out to be a forgotten scarecrow.
meanings.sent4: His smile was an artefact of joy, brightening the room with its presence.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti on the wall was an artefact of urban culture, telling its own story.
